short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Select any text, learn something new.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Select any text to search Wikipedia. Read full articles right where you are.

Fast, versatile, no context-switching.  Private, no tracking, only contacts wikipedia.org.

1. Search

- Select any text to search on Wikipedia.
- Use language detection or choose manually from 300+ Wikis.
- Press Alt- or Option-Key to add another text to your search.
- Presents more than one result, explore multiple angles.

2. Read

- Click a result, see its Wikipedia page in a sidebar, no context-switching.
- Full version of Wikipedia, no summary, click any link.
- All external links are opened in a new tab.

3. Explore 

- Select any text in the Wikipedia article to search the same way described above.
- Automatically lists 99 related articles at the bottom, enough to get lost.

4. Sleep

- Click the extension icon in the browser's address bar to disable it for all pages.
- Press Alt-D to do the same.
- No tracking, no data stored outside of your computer.
- Only contacts wikipedia.org.
